alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 22 at 1:04PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Salmon Falls Creek Near Salmon Falls Creek near San Jacinto affecting Elko County. Lamoille Creek Above Lamoille affecting Elko County. Humboldt River At Palisade affecting Eureka County. Bruneau River At Rowland affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river flows. An active and wet weather pattern during the midweek may increase river levels and flows, especially along the Humboldt River and Lamoille Creek. For the Lamoille Creek...including Test - Lamoille, Lamoille... elevated river levels are forecast. For the Lower Humboldt...including Palisade, Battle Mountain, Comus...elevated river levels are forecast. For the Salmon Falls Creek...including Salmon Falls Creek near San Jacinto...elevated river levels are forecast. For the Bruneau River...including Rowland...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Bruneau River At Rowland. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Minor flooding of Forest Service roads. Recreational use becomes limited. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:25 PM PDT Monday the stage was 6.6 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at 200 PM PDT.
